That's great! Slack Bolt is a popular Python library for building Slack bots. Here are some resources that can help you get started:

1. The Slack Bolt documentation is a great place to start. It covers everything from installing the library to building and deploying your bot. You can find it here: <https://pypi.org/project/slack-bolt/>
2. The Slack Bolt examples repository is a great resource for seeing how other people have built bots using the library. You can find it here: <https://github.com/spullen/slack-bolt-examples>
3. The Slack API documentation is also a valuable resource. It covers everything from the basic API endpoints to more advanced features like webhooks and reactions. You can find it here: <https://api.slack.com/docs/concepts>

Good luck with your bot!
write me a simple python script to handle app_mention

Sure, here's a simple Python script that uses the Slack Bolt library to handle app_mentions:
```python
import os
from slack_bolt import App
from slack_bolt.adapter.socket_mode import SocketModeHandler

app = App(token=os.environ["SLACK_APP_TOKEN"])

@app.event("app_mention")
def handle_app_mention(event, say):
    # Get the user who mentioned the app
    mentioned_user = event["user"]
    mentioned_user_id = mentioned_user["id"]

    # Send a message back to the user thanking them for mentioning the app
    response = "Thanks for mentioning our app! We appreciate your feedback."
    say(response, ephemeral=True, to=mentioned_user_id)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    handler = SocketModeHandler(app, os.environ["SLACK_APP_TOKEN"])
    handler.start()
```
This script sets up an event listener for the `app_mention` event, which is triggered when someone mentions the app in a channel. When the event is triggered, the script gets the user ID of the person who mentioned the app and sends a message back to them thanking them for their feedback.

Note that you'll need to replace `os.environ["SLACK_APP_TOKEN"]` with your own Slack app token. Also, make sure you have the Slack Bolt library installed and imported correctly.
